1. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
2. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 3. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
4. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 5. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
6. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 7. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 8. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.
column6: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.
column8: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.

column2: 9. Motor crashes are caused by:
column6: errors on the part of the driver.

column2: 10. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
11. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: remove the sign and move forward.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column10: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column10: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 14. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column8: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column10: they already are within the intersection.

column2: 15. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 16. This signal means:
17. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
18. Aggressive drivers:
column4: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
20. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column6: slow down at the traffic signal.
column8: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 21. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
22. Drivers approaching a green traffic light:
column4: must yield to oncoming traffic before making a left hand turn.
column6: always have the right of way.
column8: must merge to the left, if possible.
column10: must stop before proceeding through the intersection.

column2: 23. Tailgating:
column4: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
column8: cannot result in a traffic citation.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 25. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column10: number of cars in front of you.
